justification: Assumptions: Junior accountant salary around $60k/year. Training and mentoring costs of $30k in first year. Productivity loss of $20k due to ramp up time. Total first year cost: $60k + $30k + $20k = $110k. Assuming 50% of those costs are recouped in employee's work output in first year, net cost is around $55k. Rounding down to $50k for the estimated economic cost to hire this junior accountant.
